page.title: 09Yattendon School
page.content: There are not enough children to field a football side, but everyone is very good at joining in whatever games we play, and the older children don't throw their weight about with the little ones. The Headmaster has taught six boys to dance the Morris, and they combine with boys from Hermitage and Falkland School in Newbury to make the Downs Morris. This year they performed at four fetes. The school is surrounded by open fields so we all know quite a lot about birds and animals. On one afternoon this term we counted up all these on our playing field: 4 baby rabbits, 2 baby owls, 2 squirrels, 8 jackdaws and 6 wood pigeons. We could'nt actually see the moles but we could see where they were digging.
